Science Week¶

science_week.py contains ScienceWeek, which can perform conversions between Earth times and MAVEN times.

class science_week.ScienceWeek¶

ScienceWeek can convert between dates and MAVEN science weeks.

ScienceWeek contains a variety of methods that can either convert a week number into a datetime.date object representing the corresponding Earth date, or convert a datetime.date object into MAVEN science weeks.

__init__()¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

current_science_week()¶

Compute today’s MAVEN science week number.

Returns

The current science week number.

Return type

int

week_date_range(week)¶

Compute the date range corresponding to the input science week.

Parameters

week (int) – The science week.

Returns

The start and end dates of the science week.

Return type

tuple

Raises

  • TypeError – Raised if the input type is incompatible with timedelta.

  • ValueError – Raised if the input has an error.

Examples

>>> ScienceWeek().week_date_range(300)
(datetime.date(2020, 8, 11), datetime.date(2020, 8, 17))
week_end_date(week)¶

Compute the date when the requested science week ended or will end.

Parameters

week (int or float) – The science week number.

Returns

The date when the science week ended or will end.

Return type

datetime.date

Raises

  • TypeError – Raised if the input type is incompatible with timedelta.

  • ValueError – Raised if the input has an error.

Examples

>>> ScienceWeek().week_end_date(300)
datetime.date(2020, 8, 17)
week_from_date(some_date)¶

Compute the MAVEN science week number at an input date.

Parameters

some_date (datetime.date) – The date to get the science week from.

Returns

The science week at the input date.

Return type

int

Raises

TypeError – Raised if the input is not an instance of datetime.date.

Examples

>>> from datetime import date
>>> ScienceWeek().week_from_date(date(2020, 1, 1))
268
week_start_date(week)¶

Compute the date when the requested science week began or will begin.

Parameters

week (int or float) – The science week number.

Returns

The date when the science week began or will begin.

Return type

datetime.date

Raises

  • TypeError – Raised if the input type is incompatible with timedelta.

  • ValueError – Raised if the input has an error.

Examples

>>> ScienceWeek().week_start_date(0)
datetime.date(2014, 11, 11)
>>> ScienceWeek().week_start_date(300)
datetime.date(2020, 8, 11)
